alert.note: Alert for Washington (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 1:43AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 345 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 143 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... East Fork Plumb Bush Creek, Vega Creek and Sand Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodlin School.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
